name: Shangri-La Hotel, Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow,
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you walk into the Shangri La you cannot help but to be impressed. We were upgraded to an executive delux river view room which was fantastic. The food and service in both the Italian and the Thai restaurants were amazing. The staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble, a special mention must go to the breakfast buffet - our advice is to get up early as it will take such a long time just trying to decide which delicacy to choose! I don't think I have ever stayed at a Hotel that has a honeycomb suspended over a silver platter which drizzled its way into a bowl - totally scrumptious. If your staying in Bangkok you simply must stay at the Shangri La!
reviews.title: Faultless Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We gave just returned form a short stay at the Bangkok Shangri-la for my wife 40th birthday. The staff were amazing and could not do enough for us, they made a birthday card and a cake. We stayed in the Krungthep Wing, which has its own entrance, staff, dinning area, pool etc. The rooms all have a superb view of the Chao Phraya river and a balcony. The rooms are close to one of the main motor routes into Bangkok, but for me, noise makes a city, close the balcony door and the sound disappear. The complementary breakfast was superb, as was afternoon tea and happy hour in the early evening.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is a very short walk to the BTS Sky Train and a further 30m to the express water ferry, so it’s perfect for getting around Bangkok. It took 15 mins to get to Siam or National Stadium for serious shopping on the train, or 25mins on the Water Ferry to the Grand Palace, Wat Arun etc.
reviews.title: Great Songkran festival at the Shangri-la Bangkok!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have stayed in a wide selection of hotels on business and pleasure around the world, New York, Las Vegas, Washington, Phoenix, San Diego, Hong Kong, St Lucia, London, Paris, Madrid etc and none of them come close to the attention to detail and quality of service provided by the staff in Bangkok. The only hotel that I can compare to the Shangri-la in terms of décor, food, etc is the Wynn in Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in Shangri La 3 days in Executive suite. Amazing hotel. Everything was good-food,service,room. View was fantastic and very pleasant Executive lounge
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights at the end on April. Having recently stayed at the Shangri- La in Singapore I feel able to make some comparison. The hotels are so similar and also so different, but I think that is more down to location rather than a difference in standards. Bangkok is a hectic environment whereas Singapore is smart and efficient. In most things I prefer Singapore every time.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation & Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean, comfortable, spacious and had all essential amenities but the bathroom size was greater in size than most London hotel rooms. Fresh fruit in the room every day. I was also especially impressed with the splendid view over the Chao Phraya River. A relaxing location.
reviews.title: Just great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet options catered for all nationalities and diets with a staggering range of options...even ice cream!
reviews.title: Two night Stop Over in the Shangri-La Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: The Business centre was well run but Bhat 180 for printing two boarding passes was a bit steep.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay in Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I must say I had high expectations. This hotel has a world-class lobby, where I've had drinks many times before - the service was always extremely good, however for the first time as a guest now I was quite disappointed indeed.
reviews.title: Past its glory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I requested a BMW 7 or S-class Mercedes for airport transfer, repeatedly stressing I do not want their standard E-class Mercedes. This was confirmed and re-confirmed, however they managed to send the E-class Mercedes anyway and then charge 2200 baht for this most ordinary "limousine".
reviews.title: mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: At check-in, no welcome drinks were offered and we had to fill in all the details ourselves standing by the counter - not a big deal but even some 3 star hotels know to do better. We were offered to upgrade the room and took the offer, however in the room we noticed that the view was much poorer than from the room we had originally booked (river was hardly visible) so we canceled this. Helpful and courteous as the staff is, we were made feel awkward at this point. We were then taken to the original room, which was smaller but had a stunning view to the river and the swimming pool. The elevators are fast, luxurious and convenient and there are so many you never have to wait for long.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Right in front of our room there were two extremely noisy, industrial-grade drying machines blowing. The staff told that the floor mat is wet and has to be dried. The machines were very audible inside the room. Luckily they were removed later in the evening.
reviews.title: Riverside Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower was nice and the water temperature was very adjustable, something that is not always the case. There was a lamp over the bath tube which had partially fallen off from the ceiling. Also a loudspeaker in the bathroom (for TV sound) was hanging from the ceiling by the wires. The hairdryer did not work in the bathroom, which is probably good for safety, but it didn't work in the other room either and we thought it's broken until we found out that all sockets in the room were so loosened that we couldn't get any of our electrical appliances properly connected and working without a lot of fiddling.
reviews.title: tired and old stay somewhere else
Great Hotel on the River
reviews.text: The Shangri-La Hotel Bangkok is a fantastic hotel, the staff are brilliant as is the location. Located on the banks of the main river through Bangkok it ensures awesome ambience. In particular breakfast and/or drinks on the outside deck which is beside the fantastic pool.

reviews.title: An amazing start to our Honeymoon
reviews.text: Staff are excellent and attentive without being overbearing. There is not much within walking distance but the BTS is just around the corner.

reviews.title: A very good choice
reviews.text: Unfortunately drinks are very expensive in particular beer by the pool or on the deck!

reviews.title: Great choice
reviews.text: We stayed at the Shangri-la Bangkok in November for 4 nights for our honeymoon. It was amazing. We were in a Deluxe Suite in the Krugthep wing and immediately upon entering the room I couldn't help but smile. The suite was massive, with a living area, a bedroom, two bathrooms and two balconies. The view from our balconies was so nice to wake up to, and we were even lucky enough to have a great view of a fireworks show on the Saturday night.

reviews.title: River side dream
reviews.text: We were made to feel special our whole stay. Phillip, our butler, was fantastic. He provided some great tips and also excellent service. He even remembered what cocktail I had the evening before! We were reminded that it was our honeymoon almost every time we returned to our room ... we received a chocolate love heart from the hotel accompanied by a lovely card, rose petals on the bed and macarons on several occasions. We also thoroughly enjoyed the two glasses of wine surrounded by rose petals that Phillip left for us. I can't express enough how thankful we were that we booked this hotel while in Bangkok because they really made our honeymoon stay something special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked directly with the hotel and got a room in the supposedly renovated "Shangri-La Wing" for with a base rate of 6500 baht per night with 1) a "free" upgrade 2) breakfast 3) 20% off spa services. Then, they add a 10% service charge, so with that and the city tax, the total was about 250 US per night. The "upgrade" is either a riverview room or a balcony room and we didn't get a choice. We got assigned a riverview room, which I must say was great, but I had been hoping for a balcony. Had I booked the balcony, it would have been only 300 baht difference so the "upgrade" is no great shakes, really.
reviews.title: Great location, style, and sevice - too bad about the construction!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was supposed to have been newly renovated but there were slight cracks in the bathtub (already?). The shower was amazing, though - they had one of those rainhead shower things. The room was decorated in gold and dark wood and there is a beautiful little window seat where you can chill and look out over the river. The bed was extremely comfortable. These things, however, I would expect for $250 per night.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Shangri-La Wing, however, is not ready for primetime yet. The first thing they told us at reception was to expect construction noise at 9 AM. Nine AM? On a weekend? Really? So much for sleeping in. Different areas of the hotel are blocked off at different times. Some of the carpets are filthy - I mean, embarassingly filthy - I know, they are doing construction and it should be fixed soon but I cannot believe they charge the rate they do with the hotel still in such a state.
reviews.title: Unmatched location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should mention that we didn't hear that much construction noise but then again, we couldn't sleep in past 9 because breakfast ends at 10. For us, the construction was more of a visual nuisance than a noisy one.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!
excellent hotel
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast and the pool areas were outstanding - and the main reason to choose the Shangri-La Wing over the Krungthep wing, as I understand. We saw the Krungthep Wing pool, which was not as nice - it is for laps, not lounging. However, you can use the S-La wing pool even if you stay in the K wing. Also great was the health club, which has a stellar jacuzzi and is free of charge for hotel guests, and the access to shuttle boats to the BTS Sky Train Station and the other luxury hotels (the Mandarin, the Peninsula). We had drinks at the Mandarin one night, the Peninsula another night,and at the S-la the third night. It was nice to be able to so easily get from one place to another and the boats are super romantic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a large room with a view of the river in a city where the average hotel room is the size of a closet with a view of the building next door. the breakfast had every thing from American to Chinese to Kosher.you arange for a in room thai massage for only 1000 bats about $33. i hear the room was fairly expensive , it was an incentive trip so i did not have to pay.
reviews.title: impressed with high standards of service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If travelling to Bangkok find it in your budget to stay on the river-it changes your perspective entirely and makes it feel like a different city.
reviews.title: Location # 1

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Plus you have access to all kinds of alternative travel along the waterways.
reviews.title: Shangri-La Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shangri-La for its price is outstanding and service is 5 star.
reviews.title: I just wonder whether their standards are slipping...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic Hotel. Beautiful rooms and staff very very pleasent and helpful. However don't pay their silly pirices for room service, massages and restuarents. Take a 5 minute walk down the road and everything is a tenth of the price. Not such nice sorroundings but just a good.
reviews.title: should be number one in Bangkok
Trip of a lifetime!!
reviews.text: We were actually there in 2006. The service was impeccable. The food was amazing. We highly recommend staying there and visiting Thailand.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for a full week with 4 kids - we had 2 connected rooms. The location is great and although the hotel is under some renovation, the staff is doing their best to make your stay plaesant and comfortable. Food/buffet is excellent. Pool is great - kids loved it, we too. Hotel is located near the central pier for taxi-boat on the river, near the BTS sky train and near an exit/access to highway - in a nutshell, good loaction to do any kind of activities.
reviews.title: Shangri La remains on top

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family of four recently stayed for Christmas in the Shangri-la. We requested and received the same Horizon Club one-bedroom suite (2432) I had stayed in before. Lovely room and view.The biggest change was a lot of ongoing renovation in the lobby and main areas of the hotel, which made for a bit of confusion at times. Overall though, another great stay. Horizon Club staff wonderful. They are good with families (also were in Delhi, which is not always the case in a largely business hotel) and the location is superb. We will come back and look forward to it.
reviews.title: As good with family as it was for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Went to Bangkok 12-2009 for 5 days as a tourist. Bangkok is one of the great cultural experiences of the world (see “See Wat Arun and die” should replace “See Naples and Die”), but is a bit chaotic and dirty so the perfect counter in staying at the Shangri-La Krungthep wing. The rooms with balconies have great views, the pools overlooking the river are beyond nice, and the Krungthep lobby restaurant so perfect I was even willing to pay the $20 for the continental breakfast even with the cult like Christmas carols sung in highly accented high-pitched English in the background on a short loop. There is a very nice outdoor hot tub in the Krungthep wing pool, but it is not heated…also strange. The staff is beyond helpful in writing out directions in Thai for the cab drivers; however, you should be sure to also have a map marked with your desired locations because some of the cab drivers may have limited literacy and/or knowledge of Bangkok. The hotel gym is quite good and has an excellent view of the river and pool. Nearby is the Sky bar on top of the State Bank Building…a 64 floor high view of Bangkok with faux neo classical architecture…great. Also nearby is Absolute Yoga….bilingual yoga with every number sung in English and uber flexible yoginas.
reviews.title: NEAR PERFECT….JUST NEEDS LESS CULT-LIKE BACKGROUND MUSIC.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights on my own, and booked a room in the slightly more exclusive and expensive Krungthep Wing (ie not the main building which they call Shangri-La). I was put in a room on the top floor (16th) and the view was lovely (see attached photo).
reviews.title: Cannot fault it! Extremely elegant hotel with superb staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Shangri La on returning to Bangkok after a tour of SE Asia, partly on holiday, partly for business. We stayed on the Horizon floor which gave access to the Club Lounge.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent. It is next to the Sky train and on the river. An excellent choice if you want to see the sites in a few days or you just want to see Bangkok from your bedroom window.
reviews.title: Very nice and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: The room are smallish, but well equipped to a modern standard. The rooms are not serviced particularly quickly in the mornings, but if you give housekeeping a ring, and tell then when you want them to come, they do their best to accommodate you. If you don't you may find your room unserviced when you return mid-afternoon.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Bangkok, Without a Doubt !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are a little harder than is normal in the west, but is usual in China.
reviews.title: 10 out of 10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Horizon club is fine most of the day, but is over-run during the cocktail hours in the evening. If you are familiar with club lounges at other hotels, you may find this a little over used. Good for holiday use, not quite what you might want for business use.
reviews.title: Great again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Third visit to the shangri-la and it was just as good. The balcony river view rooms are amazing and the view is fantastic. Breakfast was out of this world, everything you can imagine. We also had dinner in the Next2 restaurant - lovely food and the passion fruit margaritas are not to be missed. All the staff were exceptionally helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel has a really lovely pool with lovely grounds a perfect oasis after wondering around Bangkok.
reviews.title: Effortless enjoyment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel for a business conference lasting a week but was lucky enough to have nearly two full days before the kick off to enjoy the surroundings.
reviews.title: Great property, fabulous service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I suspect that competition between the business / conference hotels is high and there is probably not a lot to choose between them. That said, the Shangri-La was immaculate in all areas and worthy of 5 stars.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room & bathroom where spacious, kept fastidiously clean and had a great view over the river. All the usual amenities; safe, ac, plasma, dvd, European power sockets etc etc etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful!
far too busy noisy and not enough staff
reviews.text: Let me start with a positive note in that the location of hotel is excellent both for Skytrain and river taxis. Having said that don't be misled by some of the fantastic praises for this hotel. My wife and I stayed there for 8 days over the New Year period. We stayed in the Horizon Club and on first day did not get room cleaned until after 3 p.m. The hotel was bursting at the seams. Three floors are dedicated to the Horizon club and clearly the staff although very polite and helpful could not cope with guests arriving in Club lounge and we were often shown into the family room (dingy and dark which we refused) or at other times into a meeting room. The poolside was overcrowded and if you were lucky enough to get a lounger you were cramped together and often found youself closer to a stranger than your partner. Breakfast in Club was adequate (if you could get a table) but the alternative buffet on 1st floor was akin to the service station at the Somme. We were shown to a table and having fought our way round the buffet returned to find another couple had been seated there. This hotel is currently not 5 stars perhaps after refurbishment it will be a lot better but at the moment I could not possibly recommend staying there.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at the Krungthep wing at the Shangri-la hotel after spending a fantastic time in Koh Samui... We found it to be pretty nice and of excellent value, however, there is definitely some room for improvement. For example;

reviews.title: A Great Peaceful Place in a Crazy City
reviews.text: - The main breakfast buffet at the Shangri-la wing is awful and has a factory like feeling...staff seemed to be overwhelmed even during the early quite morning hours... We had to wait for at least 20 min before a waiter came to our table for drinks and I didnt even get a napkin and had to ask for silverware..the food quality was lower than average compared to other 5 stars hotels in Asia.. Dirty dishes on neighouring empty tables were left forever and nothing was cleared promptly. Basically the service and food quality were of low class. We only went there once and decided to eat the at Krunthep wing which was much smaller but of higher quality

reviews.title: great
reviews.text: - Check in: was super slow.. we had an intern dealing with us and having someone helping her would have been nice for both

reviews.title: good quality hotel, great pool area, however very impersonal
reviews.text: - Thai restaurant: great location but food was not authentic and not of high quality .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying tat the Shangri La was one of the highlights of our trip to Bangkok. The location is very convenient and the amenities are above par. The hotel makes great use of its riverside location, especially with its great Thai restaurant and its breakfast cafe. We made use of most of the hotel facilities. Pool side is very comfortable and well attended. If you can book a Horizon Club room you'll be very pleased with the nightly happy hour. Our room was well sized, and had a great view of the river. One suggestion, not a complaint, is that the hotel include the menu for each of its restaurants in the room. Tired after being out and about in the heat we decided to order from the excellent Italian restaurant for take out. It would have been easier if the menu had already been in the room. Don't miss the chocolate bar either.
reviews.title: Just GREAT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute we stepped out of our stuffy taxi and into the grand, air-conditioned entrance hall, the Shangri-La Hotel was above excellent.
reviews.title: More Than 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had opted to stay in the Krungthrep wing after reading its many good reviews and it certainly lived up to its staggering reputation -even exceeding it. We were evidently the last people to check in that day (Otherwise the receptionist had psychic powers when she greeted my boyfriend by name...) and showed us directly to our room -no waiting round at a check in desk! Our bags were whisked up several minutes later, almost as if by magic and refreshing drinks and towels were bought immediately.
reviews.title: Might be the best hotel in Bangkok!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very spacious and plush. The bed and pillows were large and luxurious. The decor was traditional but well executed and suited to the hotel. Generally, I am in agreement that there is a fine line between grandeur and tacky -the Shangri-La somehow however manages to pull off grandeur in spectacular style. Furthermore, in my opinion, the in-room facilities were above 5* and far to numerous to list them all here.
reviews.title: Quiet location, amazing views and friendly associates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the lavish rooms, it is the small details and fantastic service which made our stay so enjoyable. We chose to book the "Krungthrep wing Experience" (from the 'offers' page) in which we were provided with a butler service. This was something I felt we had absolutely no need for, (having two arms and legs I find that I am able to do most things for myself) yet our butler Natalie, always found a way to make our stay that little bit 'extra special'.
reviews.title: We did get good sleep, good breakfast and dips in the pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 days in the Krungthep wing and both of us enjoyed it very much, the room was very nice and the staff excelent and helpfull.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: Nice pool with cold towelettes and water served as soon as you got out, cocktails in the evening and a friendly singing duo that proved to be great fun.
reviews.title: Great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel sits next to the skytrain which makes for very convienent traveling to the markets etc without the traffic worries of Bangkok.
reviews.title: So so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Would definatley stay again
reviews.title: Great place, I loved it.
Be Aware, No Deposits Back!
reviews.text: My family and I live in Bangkok and were given a night's stay at the Shangri-La in recognition of our anniversary. Would say that we had an above-average stay, nice check-in, very friendly service and a view we shall never forget from the ninth floor, as we were upgraded upon check-in. We brought clothing for only one night, as we live in Bangkok and only needed clothing for the next day. We took a dinner cruise along the river shortly after checking in and when we returned we noticed that someone had been in the room to bring fruit and turn down the bed... however, our underclothes were missing! Also noticed on two occassions that the staff did not knock on the door, but rather simply used their keycard to enter the room, apologizing after finding us inside!

reviews.title: Extremely attentive !
reviews.text: From the moment we walked in we were given 5 star service. Our butler was helpful , and one of the staff at breakfast was very helpful offering us advice on where to visit. Nothing seemed too much bother !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: The room was great , it was big , with a lovely chandelier. The complimentary cocktails and canapees were really nice , and a great touch!
reviews.title: Good brand name-or just used to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was a little expensive , however the ambiance and environment was supurb woth the massage being great !
reviews.title: Wonderful base for touring Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Only thing i was thought could of been better , was the shower , the grouting wasnt great and looked almost dirty , i wouldnt expect that from a 5 star.
reviews.title: 2nd stay and even better than 1st!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall amazing place to stay at a reasonable price for a 5 star !
reviews.title: Shangri- La in honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights in a deluxe suite in the Krunthep wing. One of the really special things about our stay was Betty, our butler. What a delightful lady! Nothing was too much trouble and there were so many lovely things she did for us (like a rose petal bath on my husband's birthday, fresh flowers in the room, essential oils in a burner). She really made our stay exceptional and I would advise you to book a suite with all the extra benefits if you can stretch to it. The extra space is fabulous and the views of the river are outstanding - there is nothing quite like opening the drapes in the morning to a spectacular view of Bangkok's river. The location of the hotel is great and the concierge will even call a long boat up to the hotel pier for you for trips out (about 800 baht per boat). To experience river life first hand, this a great location.
reviews.title: Great location, good service
Customer Service Needs Work
reviews.text: The Shangrila is a lovely hotel - very peaceful and a great break from Bangkok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was beautiful overlooking to River - and the bonus of free breakfast, tea and cocktails make the Krungthep wing a wonderful place to escape the heat, rest and relax.
reviews.title: Disasterous stay saved by hotel staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was not impressed, however, with the staff, which is too sad. I didn't find them to be tremendously concerned with helping out. They did the minimum but did not go out of their way to ensure guests were happy. For a hotel of this class/price, one would expect more.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel - under renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 2nd time at Shangri-La and we paid for a suite. The first 2 nights, we had 5 electrical outages in our room. The hotel staff got to know us quite well due to that. They couldn't move us because the hotel was booked but finally did on our last night when the electricity went out yet again. The managers personally took care of us and most of our hotel bill; they recovered what could've been a complete disaster into something positive. Because of the actions of the managers, we're most likely going to stay there again later this year.
reviews.title: They are working on it - service
The "new" pool policy
reviews.text: We've been staying here since 1987 and have never been disappointed. That being said, I do think the hotel could use a cosmetic update (rugs are stained, wallpaper is a bit old and out of date). The staff were friendly and efficient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I did have one definite concrete complaint. We have always been able to swim in BOTH pools. This time, we're staying in the older hotel wing. When I went over to the newer Krung Tep wing pool, I was politely but firmly told that I could NOT swim in that pool. I was disappointed. This pool policy change was not listed anywhere on the hotel website or at the hotel property. I told the duty manager that I had been a loyal guest but that didn't matter. Guests staying in the Krung Tepwing can use both pools.I realize this might seem like a minor complaint but I think others should know about this so they can book their roooms accordingly.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great hotel with great service. Location is nice as it is right by the rives. My colleaugue and I enjoyed our late night beers on their terrace by the river. I cannot think of any complaints about this establishment.
reviews.title: Don't believe the hype

likes.liked: — location as its near river and overhead train

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: It keeps being touted in multiple guide books as one of Bangkok's/Asia's best hotel, but I really have to disagree there.
reviews.title: Love it - best spa ever!

likes.liked: — Everything - Spa, Cuisine, Friendly Staff & Pools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception service was rubbish, had to wait two hours for room.
reviews.title: Top Marks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Do not stay here!
reviews.title: Damp and in need of serious renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to be shown a room greatly in need of renovation. We complained and were upgraded to another room - which, again, smelled strongly of damp. We decided to move to the Oriental; which was simply wonderful.
reviews.title: Paradise at Shangri La

likes.disliked: — Location not close to shopping area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Shangri la cannot be classed as a 5 star - there is absolutely no comparison with the Oriental. Don't waste your money here.
reviews.title: Honeymoon from heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 1 night on our way back home from a 10 day trip to Koh Samui and we were so sorry it was only 1 night.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel!
Heaven
reviews.text: Location:

description: The Shangri-La Hotel, Bangkok, is a 5-star luxury hotel in Silom district, Bangkok. The design and appointments express the welcoming warmth and richness of Thai culture throughout the hotel, from traditional teak dining pavilions to the most up-to-date room features.The hotel has a total of 802 rooms including 72 suites in two wings, Shangri-La and Krungthep, and is adjacent to the Saphan Taksin station of the Skytrain, Bangkok's elevated metro system.The hotel also offers fully-serviced apartments for guests wishing a longer stay.
